claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Melanie Richards Griffith  (  born August 9 , 1957  )  is an American actress .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Griffith began her career as an adolescent in nonspeaking film roles before making her credited debut opposite Gene Hackman in Arthur Penn 's Night Moves  (  1975  )  .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: She rose to prominence for her role in Brian De Palma 's Body Double  (  1984  )  , which earned her a National Society of Film Critics Award for Best Supporting Actress .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Griffith 's subsequent performance in Something Wild  (  1986  )  garnered critical acclaim before she was cast in 1988 's Working Girl , which earned her a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress and won her a Golden Globe .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The 1990s saw Griffith in a series of roles which received varying critical reception : she received Golden Globe nominations for her performances in Buffalo Girls  (  1995  )  , and as Marion Davies in RKO 281  (  1999  )  , while also earning a Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Actress for her performances in Shining Through  (  1992  )  , as well as receiving nominations for Crazy in Alabama  (  1999  )  and John Waters ' cult film Cecil B. Demented  (  2000  )  .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Other roles include in John Schlesinger 's Pacific Heights  (  1990  )  , Milk Money  (  1994  )  , the neo-noir film Mulholland Falls  (  1996  )  , as Charlotte Haze in Adrian Lyne 's Lolita  (  1997  )  , and Another Day in Paradise  (  1998  )  .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: She later starred as Barbara Marx in The Night We Called It a Day  (  2003  )  , and has appeared on the television series Nip/Tuck , Raising Hope , and Hawaii Five-0 .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: After acting on stage in London , in 2003 she made her Broadway debut in a revival of the musical Chicago , receiving celebratory reviews that made it a box office success .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Something Wild is a 1986 American action comedy film directed by Jonathan Demme and starring Melanie Griffith , Jeff Daniels and Ray Liotta .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Milk Money is a 1994 American romantic comedy film directed by Richard Benjamin and starring Melanie Griffith and Ed Harris .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Loosely based on the 1988 film of the same name starring Melanie Griffith , the series stars Sandra Bullock as Tess McGill  (  Melanie Griffith 's character in the film  )  , in a role that was initially meant for Nancy McKeon .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Two Much is a 1995 romantic screwball comedy film based on Donald Westlake 's novel of the same name , and is also a remake of the 1984 French comedy film Le Jumeau , which was also based on Westlake 's novel .

claim: Melanie Griffith was in an American action comedy film.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Cecil B. Demented is a 2000 American black comedy film written and directed by John Waters .
